intro: Leea ancolana, commonly known as the red-flowered leeah, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Leeaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink or red, depending on the variety. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires a warm, humid climate to flourish. Leea ancolana is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
